turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, as a "standard"... I'll hang with "is the guy telling the truth?"

turns.speaker: HELEN CAPERELLI
turns.text: Well, with tortious interference, I'm afraid... the greater the truth, the greater the damage.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: HELEN CAPERELLI
turns.text: They own the information he's disclosing. The truer it is, the greater the damage to them. If he lied, he didn't disclose their information. And the damages are smaller.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Is this "Alice in Wonderland"?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Is CBS corporate telling CBS News do not go to air with this story?

turns.speaker: HELEN CAPERELLI
turns.text: You're getting ahead of yourself. We're all in this together. We're all CBS. We'll find out soon. Thank you, gentlemen.

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER
turns.text: Hey, Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: How are you, Jim?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER
turns.text: Hey, listen, I hear you guys are sitting on something sensational over there.

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER
turns.text: Hi, baby.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Catch you later.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: How prominent? What kind of placement?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER
turns.text: Oh, c'mon, Lowell. This is The New York Times. I don't know...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, until you do, all I can tell you is what you already know... they will not air an interview.

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER
turns.text: Call me back in ten.

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jim, it's Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Here's how it works. You ask me questions. I tell you if you're wrong.

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: Okay.  Lowell?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: You're sure you want to do this?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: Hey, it doesn't work? You've burned your bridges, man.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You ready...?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: Okay... About this whistle-blower... Did Mike and Don go along with the corporate decision?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: Lowell?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Did I tell you you were wrong?

turns.speaker: JIM COOPER'S VOICE
turns.text: No.  I'm assuming the cave-in begins with the threat of litigation from Big Tobacco. Are we talking... are we talking Brown & Williamson, here?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I can take her.

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Don't you have to be at the office?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Is there any more rice...?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Yes, it's on the stove...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: I'm sorry, darling, have you seen my coffee mug...?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Try the car.

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Uh, what are those boxes?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I'm going to the store. You need anything?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: What do you need at the store?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Soy sauce...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Right now?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: That's my stuff from the office...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Why did you take your stuff from the office?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I didn't want to leave it there...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I got fired this morning... Where else am I gonna take it?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Why? Who said?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Thomas Sandefur...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: What are we supposed to do...? What about our medical coverage; what about our health? What about our car payments? The payments on this house?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: There's a severance agreement... It includes cash payouts over time and continuing medical coverage...  Sure you don't need anything?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: I told him that you had an E-mail death threat that said if you didn't shut the "F" up, they were going to kill you...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: ...taping?  What are you taping?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I'm doing an interview.

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: An interview! Do you know what they will do to us...! I thought... Sorry.

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Please don't wash your hands in the sink.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Where should I wash them?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Use the bathroom.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What's the difference...

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: That's for food.

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: I don't think I can do this... I want to stand by my husband... I really do, Jeffrey. But I don't think I can do this anymore. I am so sorry...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Can we talk about this when I get back?

turns.speaker: LIANE
turns.text: Yes... Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Thank you, Bob.

turns.speaker: LIANE'S VOICE
turns.text: Who's calling?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: My name's Lowell Bergman... I'm --

turns.speaker: LIANE'S VOICE
turns.text: Did you say Berman?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No, Bergman... B.E.R.G.M.A.N.... I'm a producer with "60 Minutes"...

turns.speaker: LIANE'S VOICE
turns.text: "60 Minutes"?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LIANE'S VOICE
turns.text: "60 Minutes," the television show?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, someone took a poll? "Are all things Canadian boring...?"

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: It's Stuart... he's in Mexico City...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Let me call you back...

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: No classes this morning?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Will he go on-camera and talk about the Mexico City branch?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Will independent sources corroborate that?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Hello? Yeah...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Let me see this... No, 'cause I gotta know where you're going at all times.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: I can't... I've got to fly to Boston tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Two p.m. Great. Bye-bye.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ..."ignition propensity?"  ...you understand any of this...?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: ...no... this looks like a table of temperatures... Who's this from?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...it's anonymous. References to "P.M."  It's got to be Philip Morris, huh?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: I have to take a shower.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: They're killing the Wigand interview...

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: They're pretending it's process. Bullshit, it's foregone.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What are you and Mike going to do?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I'm alone on this...

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Oh, baby...

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Jeffrey Wigand...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jeffrey...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: "I'm Lowell Bergman, I'm from '60 Minutes.'" You know, you take the "60 Minutes" out of that sentence, nobody returns your phone call. Maybe Wigand's right. Maybe I'm hooked. What am I hooked on? The rush? "60 Minutes"? What the hell for? Infotainment. It's so fucking useless, all of it.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: So, it's a big country with a free press. You can go work somewhere else.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Free press? Press is free... for anyone who owns one. Larry Tisch has a free press.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Get some perspective, Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I got perspective.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: No, you do not.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: From my perspective, what's been going on and what I've been doing is ridiculous. It's half-measures.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: You're not listening.  Really know what you're going to do before you do it.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: WIGAND'S VOICE
turns.text: ...you fucked me!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: WIGAND'S VOICE
turns.text: Is it too late?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No. No, it's okay... How's -- how's the new place?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: WIGAND'S VOICE
turns.text: You're not even on this anymore... What do you care?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jeff! Wake the fuck up! Everybody is on the line here. If they can catch you in a lie, they can paint everything with that brush. Do you understand? Everything you say!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yes, I'm right here. Could you call me back on a hard line?

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: I'll call you then.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...you filed a lawsuit against tobacco on behalf of the State of Mississippi, did you not?

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: That's right...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, I'm working with someone, now, who was the former head of research at Brown & Williamson, a former corporate officer there.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: What's your interest in this, Mr. Bergman?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, he may tape an interview with us. And, we believe if his testimony showed up in a court record first, it would free him up from his confidentiality agreement and give him some protection.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: Has he decided to go public? Because let me tell you, we've been doing this for three years now, and we've worked with a lot of corporate cases involving whistle-blowers, so we know... Big Tobacco will do everything in their power to stop him. So, is your man truly committed?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, actually, no. Well, he's on the fence. That's the point.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: Well, we'd certainly be interested in making his acquaintance, but without knowing what he's going to do...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, would you want him to call you? Or, you want to call him? How do you want to do it?

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: It would be better if he called us.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: Alright?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Okay. Thank you.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah, I'm here.

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: What chance is there of getting Jeff's interview on the air...?

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: ...I'd be lying to you if I did not tell you how important it was in the court of public opinion...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...and I'd be lying to you if I didn't tell you, I'm about out of moves, Dick...

turns.speaker: RICHARD SCRUGGS
turns.text: All right. See you...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: We're there.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Good, well ask him if Arabic is his second language.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Don't interpret that!  Hold it. Hold it. Hold it! Slow, slow!!  Sheikh, do you mind... if you would just turn your chair a little bit to face Mr. Wallace?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...come in earlier on Mike's Marine barracks line when he's talking to Sheikh Mussawi...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: You eating with us?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Bring a tie so they'll let us in the front door...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: He referred to this... the Seven Dwarfs...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: What "Seven Dwarfs?"

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: The seven CEOs of Big Tobacco... Referred to this... Said they should be afraid of him... I assume, afraid of what he could reveal.  Now, you tell me. What does this guy have to say that threatens these people?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Well, it isn't "cigarettes are bad for you"...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Hardly new news.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Okay, let's look through the looking glass the other way...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: We got a guy... who wants to talk but he's constrained.  What if he were "compelled"?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Oh, torture? Great ratings.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: So, is everything okay?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: How are the rooms? Comfortable?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Thank you for saying that...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Do you think we could talk about the taping? Tomorrow's taping, just so we can get it out of the way and order...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Yeah, well, questions will go toward what work you did there, why you were fired. And others will deal...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, man.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Who are these people?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Ordinary people! Under extraordinary pressure, Mike. What the hell do you expect? Grace and consistency?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: It went great in Mississippi, Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I think what we're trying to tell you is that it happens all the time. This is a news organization. People are always telling us things they shouldn't. We have to verify if it's true and in the public interest... And if it is, we air it.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: After we corroborate it. That's why we've never lost a lawsuit and run a classy show.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I discovered this. SEC filing...  For the sale of the CBS Corporation to Westinghouse Corporation.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: "Put the corporation at risk"...? Give me a fucking break!

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: These people are putting our whole reason for doing what we do... on the line!

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Lowell!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: I'm with Don on this.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I've been banished. In lieu of being fired.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: I took off on Tisch. I took off on corporate. They'll know they're not going to see everything on Sunday night...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I don't know. How does that get Wigand on the air?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Do me a favor, will you? Spare me, for God's sake. Get in the real world. What do you think? I'm going to resign in protest? To force it on the air? The answer is "no." I don't plan to spend the end of my days wandering in the wilderness of National Public Radio.  That decision I've already made.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: You disappeared on me. How long you staying?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I disappeared on you?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Alright. What did you think?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I think it was a disgrace.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Did I get you up?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No, I usually sit around in my hotel room, dressed like this at 5:30 in the morning, sleepy look on my face.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: How many shows have we done? Huh? C'mon, how many?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, lots.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Yeah, that's right.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: But in all that time, Mike, did you ever get off a plane, walk into a room, and find that a source for a story changed his mind? Lost his heart? Walked out on us? Not one fucking time! You want to know why?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: I see a rhetorical question on the horizon.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I'm going to tell you why. Because when I tell someone I'm going to do something, I deliver.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Oh, how fortunate I am to have Lowell Bergman's moral tutelage to point me down the shining path. To show me the way.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, please, Mike...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: Give me a break!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No, you give me a break! I never left a source hung out to dry, ever. Abandoned. Not 'til right fucking now! When I came on this job, I came with my word intact. I'm gonna leave with my word intact. Fuck the rules of the game! Hell, you're supposed to know me, Mike. What the hell did you expect? You expect me to lie down? Back off? What, get over it?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: In the real world, when you get to where I am, there are other considerations...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Like what? Corporate responsibility? What, are we talking celebrity here?

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: I'm not talking celebrity, vanity, CBS. I'm talking about when you're nearer the end of your life than the beginning. Now, what do you think you think about then? The future? "In the future I'm going to do this? Become that?"  What "future"? No. What you think is: how will I be regarded in the end? After I'm gone.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Mike... in my...

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: You and I have been doing this together for fourteen years.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: That Canada story? Still interest you?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Everything interests me.

turns.speaker: MIKE WALLACE
turns.text: C'mon, it all worked out. You came out okay in the end...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I did? What do I tell a source on the next tough story? Hang in with us. You'll be fine... maybe?

turns.speaker: THE SHEIKH
turns.text: Coffee?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah... Thank you.

turns.speaker: THE SHEIKH
turns.text: How have you liked your stay?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: What I've seen... I've liked.

turns.speaker: THE SHEIKH
turns.text: Please to explain, why I should agree to interview... with pro-Zionist American media?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Because I think Hezbollah is trying to broaden into a political party right now. So you care about what you're thought of in America. And in America, at this moment in time, Hezbollah does not have a face.  That's why.

turns.speaker: THE SHEIKH
turns.text: Perhaps you prove journalism objectivity and I see the questions first. Then I decide if I grant the interview.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No. We don't do that.  You've seen "60 Minutes" and Mike Wallace. So you know our reputation for integrity and objectivity. You also know we are the highest-rated, most-respected, TV-magazine news show in America.

turns.speaker: THE SHEIKH
turns.text: Tell him I will see him day after tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's good. That works.  Uh, you know, I want to ask you something... I know it sounds odd... but...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's room service. They usually knock first.  Come on in... Over here, please.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: How do you like your coffee? Black?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Black, black...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Look, I really don't have that much time...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Is there anything you want to know about me, Mr. Wigand...?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Like what? Your sign?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I know what I have to know.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Just so I know you know, when I talk to people in confidence, it stays that way.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: How did a radical journalist from Ramparts Magazine end up at CBS?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ...but that's as far as I go...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Far as you go where?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: This issue is a drop in the bucket. I can talk to you about what's in here. But I can't talk to you about anything else.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Doesn't CBS have confidentiality agreements, Mr. Bergman?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Between journalists and management, yes, I believe they do... but I don't take that seriously.  Where do you work?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Did work.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Did work.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: How much would I get paid?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That, you have to discuss with CBS Business Affairs. But, for something like this, I would say anywhere between 10, 12 thousand.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Should I just take the documents now?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: If you want to do it.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ...protect your sources...! You screwed me! You sold me out!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: What are you talking about? Where are you?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Fuck you, too!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Mrs. Wigand, how do you do?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Jump in, quick, c'mon...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I'm Lowell Bergman. We spoke on the phone, remember?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: C'mere. I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Good. I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What do...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I did not burn you. I did not give you up to anyone!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: This is my house... In front of my wife, my kids?! What business do we have?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: To straighten something out with you. Right here. Right now.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: So, you didn't mention my name? You haven't talked to anybody about me?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Why am I gonna mention your name?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: How did Brown & Williamson know I spoke to you...?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: How the hell do I know about Brown & Williamson?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: It happened after I talked to you. I do not like coincidences!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: And I don't like paranoid accusations! I'm a journalist. Think. Use your head. How do I operate as a journalist by screwing the people who could provide me with information before they provided me with it?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You came all the way down here to tell me that?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No. I did not. Big Tobacco is a big story. And you got something important to say. I can tell.  But, yes. I did. I came all the way down here to tell you: story, no story, fuck your story, I don't burn people.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: And, I'm unemployed. So I have to protect my medical coverage.  ...so I left them a message this morning. Their expanded confidentiality agreement? I will sign it.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: They're afraid of you, aren't they?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: They should be.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Talk to me outside the zone of your agreement?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Like where'd you work before Brown & Williamson?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Johnson & Johnson. Union Carbide in Japan. I was general manager and director of new products. I speak Japanese. I was a director of corporate development at Pfizer. All health-related.  What else? Outside the "zone"...?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I don't know... you think the Knicks are gonna make it through the semi- finals?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Seven dwarfs?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: The seven CEOs of Big Tobacco... they got up in front of Congress that time... it was on television...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...and swore under oath that they know nothing about addiction, disease...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: It was on C-SPAN. Yeah.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Okay, so, here you are... you go to work for tobacco.  You come from corporate cultures where research, really, creative thinking, these are core values. You go to tobacco... Tobacco is a sales culture. Market and sell enormous volume. Go to a lot of golf tournaments. The hell with everything else.  What are you doing? Why are you working for "tobacco" in the first place?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I can't talk about it. The work I was supposed to do... might have had some positive effect. I don't know... it could have been beneficial.  Mostly, I got paid a lot. I took the money. My wife was happy. My kids had good medical. Good schools. Got a great house.  I mean, what the hell is wrong with that...?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I've always thought of myself... as a man of science. That's what's wrong with it.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Then... you're in a state of conflict, Jeff.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: The new place? New.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You know, I was thinking of calling you tomorrow, anyway.  How are your kids handling the new house?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Good.  You have kids?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: No, you said you were going to call me tomorrow. So, what about?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, yes, yes, yes, I did... I wanted to talk to you. I wanted to hook up and talk to you. About what we were talking about in your car.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ...okay.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Makes you feel good? Putting what you know to use?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: How'd you know that, Lowell?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: It's obvious, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Hello. You there

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Yeah... Look, thanks for talking. I'm sorry I woke you up.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: What did you get us?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Tempura...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: The internet said you did graduate work in Wisconsin, then went to UC La Jolla with Professor... Marcus?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Marcuse. Yeah. He was my mentor. He had a major influence on the New Left in the late '60s... and on me, personally.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Next to your father?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: My father? What the hell's that got to do with my father?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Is that why you became a journalist? Then you get to ask all the questions?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You charge by the hour?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: My father was a mechanical engineer... most ingenious man I ever knew.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Well, my father left us when I was five-years old. He was not the most ingenious man I ever knew... Let's get back to Brown & Williamson. If you decide to go on "60 Minutes," I got to know everything about why you got fired.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: They're gonna dig up stuff from your past, they're gonna throw it at you. I got to know what they're gonna throw. You understand?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I drink. A couple of occasions more than I should have.  I was cited for shoplifting once. But it was a mistake...  I pushed Liane one time. We were both stressed out because of the pressure. She went to her mother's.  I got fired because when I get angry I have difficulty censoring myself. And I don't like to be pushed around!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I'm not pushing you around!  I'm asking you questions.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I'm just a commodity to you, aren't I? I could be anything. Right? Anything worth putting on between commercials...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...to a network, probably, we're all commodities.  To me? You are not a commodity. What you are is important.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You should. Because when you're done, a judgment is going to go down in the court of public opinion, my friend. And that's the power you have.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I believe that? Yes, I believe that.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You believe that because you get information out to people... something happens?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Maybe that's just what you've been telling yourself all these years to justify having a good job? Having status? And maybe for the audience, it's just voyeurism? Something to do on a Sunday night. And maybe it won't change a fucking thing. And people like myself and my family are left hung out to dry. Used up! Broke, alone!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Are you talking to me or did somebody else just walk in here?! I never abandoned a source!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I don't think you really understand --

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No, don't evade a choice you gotta make be questioning my reputation or "60 Minutes'" with this cheap skepticism!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I have to put my family's welfare on the line here, my friend! And what are you puttin' up? You're puttin' up words!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Words! While you've been dickin' around at fucking company golf tournaments, I been out in the world, giving my word and backing it up with action.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Excuse me. Yeah...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: They're terrorizing us. Death threats?! To my family? My kids?!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jeff, call the FBI right away...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: They do this with impunity!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jeff...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: They get to go home at night. What does it cost these people to do this to us? Nothing?! My girls are crying, so fuck them! I want to tape! I'm done thinking about it.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Good. But Jeff...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I'll call them, Lowell.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Liane, this is a preliminary...  You didn't tell her we were taping? What did she think she was coming to New York for?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ...to talk about it. To think about it. I had a plan to ease her into it. But, I really -- I didn't know how to do that...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Lowell, I can't afford --

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ...they "volunteered." A friend owns a large security company.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I called Richard Scruggs in Mississippi...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I heard.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I'm going to be a witness for them in their litigation. So I'm going to fly to Pascagoula to give a deposition...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I know. I'm going to go there tonight...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Did you have a good day?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You attract a crowd.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Yeah, great.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I heard about the Kentucky gag order...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What's changed?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: You mean... since this morning?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: No. I mean since whenever...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: "Part of the reason I'm here is I felt that their representation clearly, at least within..."

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Run that Sandefur piece on "nicotine's not addictive." Run that on-camera. Then cut right to Wigand with "I believe they perjured..." Then go wide to the CEOs all taking the oath. Back on Jeff and play the pause after the word "felt" on the B-side...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I don't know how to say this, Jeff, except to just say it right out, so I'll say it. They do not want to air it.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: B & W may have threatened litigation... CBS is on the block...  But you, I mean, I know how...

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: No? No, what?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I do not think that you "know" for me... what it is to walk in my shoes...  ...for my kids to have seen it... for them to know why I've put them through what I did... the public airing of that... the testament to why I did what I did... you're telling me is not going to see the light of day.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Oh, you know what we do or do not need to know? Since when have you become a media expert?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What do you want to do, Lowell, look up my ass, too...!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I told the truth!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Everything... you... say! And I can't defend you, man, with one hand tied behind my back! Because you keep from me... what they can discover. And they will discover everything! Believe me.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ...I was young. I was young... confused... We didn't handle it the right way...

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: She sued you for back payments of child support?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: She did not sue me. We had a dispute over money... I settled it, she dropped the complaint...  Any other questions?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yes. Did you lie about being on the American Judo Team in the Olympics?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Some public relations guy got a hold of a tape of an interview... where you're saying you were on the American Judo Team in the Olympics...?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What kind of shit is this? I was not on the team, I sparred with the Olympic Team... okay?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Alright... the ABC Telemarketing Company?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: ABC...?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: ABC Telemarketing Company.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: A can opener! A $39.95 can opener. I canceled payment... It was junk.  You ever bounce a check, Lowell? You ever look at another woman's tits? You ever cheat a little on your taxes?  Whose life, if you look at it under a microscope, doesn't have any flaws...?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's the whole point, Jeffrey. That's the whole point. Anyone's. Everyone's. They are gonna look under every rock, dig up every flaw, every mistake you've ever made. They are going to distort and exaggerate everything you've ever done, man. Don't you understand?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What does this have to do with my testimony?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's not the point.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: What does this have to do with my testimony?! I told the truth! It's valid and true and provable!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's not the fucking point, whether you told the truth or not! Hello...?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I told the truth... I told the truth.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: I've got to teach class. I've got to go. I've got to teach class.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: And I've got to refute every fucking accusation made in this report before The Wall Street Journal runs.  I am trying to protect you, man!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You manipulated me into this...!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: That's bullshit, Jeff!

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You greased the rails!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I greased the rails for a guy who wanted to say yes. I helped him to say yes. Alright. You're not a robot, Jeff! That's all. You got a mind of your own, don't you?

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: "Up to you, Jeffrey. That's the power you have, Jeffrey. Vital insider information the American public need to know." Lowell Bergman, the hot show who never met a source he couldn't turn around.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I fought for you... and I still fight for you.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You fought for me...?!  ...you manipulated me... into where I am now... staring at the Brown & Williamson Building. It's all dark. Except the 10th floor! That's the legal department. That's where they fuck with my life!

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Jeffrey, where you going with this? So where you goin'?  You are important to a lot of people, Jeffrey. You think about that. You think about them.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: Where are you, anyway?

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: I'm on a leave of absence. Forced vacation.

turns.speaker: WIGAND
turns.text: You try and have a good time.

turns.speaker: LOWELL
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, I will.
